title: uche6215
author: uche6215
content: If bitcoin crash today, what will be your fate? Poor or rich. Most people on the platform have submitted all their life savings to bitcoin investment. There was once a man in my area who sold his house to invest in a local platform called BARAZAR in 4 months missive the so-called BARAZAR was shoot down and now he does not have a cottage. So I ask again if bitcoin crashed today what will be your description rich or poor?

comments.author: Hamphser
comments.body: Quote from: uche6215 on February 16, 2023, 09:49:30 PMIf bitcoin crash today, what will be your fate? Poor or rich. Most people on the platform have submitted all their life savings to bitcoin investment. There was once a man in my area who sold his house to invest in a local platform called BARAZAR in 4 months missive the so-called BARAZAR was shoot down and now he does not have a cottage. So I ask again if bitcoin crashed today what will be your description rich or poor? You wont be poor if you have invested on the money you can afford to lose.You wont be poor as long you dont realize those losses on your portfolioYou wont be poor as long you dont panic sell.On the time that you had decided on making up some investment towards this market then you should make yourself that embrace on things that might encounter along the way specially with volatility.There's no way that we could really be able to know on what would be ahead.If ever Bitcoin would crash today then i would definitely be finding some sources for me to accumulate more.As long the demand and interest is intact on bitcoin then chances or tendency for some recovery is really that likely.So better buy on the bottom as always.

comments.author: goaldigger
comments.body: Just do my usual work and I can be fine.There’s a lot of uncertainty with Bitcoin, and if you depend on that much you’re probably on a big trouble once this market collapse. Going all in is not advisable at all regardless of your reason, because for me its greed and being greedy can’t help you that much. If Bitcoin crashes today, many will surely happen but you can save yourself if you’ll do something now to assess your exposure with Bitcoin, just take the risk you can afford.

This is an almost impossible hypothesis, and there is no point in raising topics that include almost impossible scenarios. Do you have a clear vision of how this could happen today, tomorrow, or at any time?Comparison between Bitcoin as a project and the project in which someone you know invested in is not permissible.When you lose in any project, this means that you have often been subjected to a process of fraud in one way or another. Bitcoin is a working base for all these projects, and the collapse of Bitcoin necessarily means the collapse of those projects.

comments.author: Scripture
comments.body: If you’re exposed with Bitcoin with all your resources then expect worst, but stop overthinking because Bitcoin will not collapse this year and I’m very certain of this because Bitcoin is able to survive a lot of financial crisis, and the pandemic.This is just a reminder as well that you should not spend your savings, your own house just to get Bitcoin, stay within your limit and live peacefully while waiting for your time to take profit with Bitcoin.

comments.author: dothebeats
comments.body: I'd still go to work and probably hold on whatever coins I have. I'm at the point wherein bitcoin is a nice investment to have, but not a necessity to me since my job pays for my needs and some wants anyways. I haven't devoted a lot to bitcoin except for my time and some $$$ that is not too serious compared to others who bet on their life savings on it. If all hell breaks loose in bitcoin tomorrow, I'd be one of the lucky ones who only lost time and some hundreds of $$$ to it based on what I have right now lol.

comments.author: Oceat
comments.body: First of all, Bitcoin will be more likely not to crash if the support from the community continue.However, if you want to see the results of someone if ever Bitcoin ever crash like the rest of those typical scam you see then, I'll just continue to live and try again next time. I don't want to risk my assets or house just to buy something that I don't know just like what that person you've mentioned. He probably thought that it's going to change his life because someone persuade him although he didn't have enough knowledge of the things he's going to invest thus, giving him a life long lesson.

comments.author: 2double0
comments.body: The best answer to your questions could be diversification. If an investor carefully understands the risks associated with his investment and invests accordingly without the requirement to go all in on a single asset and investing your total or more than total portfolio, then there is zero chance that an investor will feel bad for their investments. And the type of crash you expect from btc is not possible now because times were different when only the retail money controlled btc but now, big giants have betted their money on crypto so that crash is not an easy task to take place.

comments.author: hatshepsut93
comments.body: That would be very bad for me, because Bitcoin is a large share of my net worth, well over 50%. But I used the profits from the last bull market to buy other assets, so it wouldn't be a complete disaster for me. I hope to see at least one bull market with prices over $50k to get more money out of Bitcoin and into other assets to further diversify my portfolio.

comments.author: Hydrogen
comments.body: Quote from: uche6215 on February 16, 2023, 09:49:30 PMIf bitcoin crash today, what will be your fate? Poor or rich. Most people on the platform have submitted all their life savings to bitcoin investment. There was once a man in my area who sold his house to invest in a local platform called BARAZAR in 4 months missive the so-called BARAZAR was shoot down and now he does not have a cottage. So I ask again if bitcoin crashed today what will be your description rich or poor? If crypto crashed, I would focus more on physical assets.Or perhaps try to expand my digital finance game.People are always searching for the next bitcoin. Wanting to be an early adopter on the next big thing. While those who lived in past eras might only have one big opportunity available to them in their lives. Today modern people are lucky enough to have access to multiple opportunities during their lives. We simply do not try as hard to make the most of them. While a big crash could be a negative event. Hopefully, it might also have some positive effect. There would be an upside to it which could be difficult to quantify. Hopefully, everyone is diversifying between digital and hard assets. While digital assets are very convenient in terms of them being electronic, there have been many attempts to destroy the internet over the years. DNS servers have been mass DDOS'ed. There have been attempts to sever portions of the internet backbone. It is known that nuclear warheads detonated over the surface of the earth can produce an EMP effect, which would neutralize electronic devices. There certainly is no shortage of scenarios for digital assets being lost. In which case, hard assets that are physical must be a necessity to any investment strategy.Whatever happens I'll always treasure that I was lucky enough to see and be a part of bitcoin's golden age.

If we are currently holding bitcoins then suddenly being no value, no choice but to accept that it's a financial loss and try our best to move on with that situation.But don't worry, if bitcoin will really crashes, don't expect that it will happen overnight. You can still prepare for that possible scenario. Although for me, I don't see Bitcoin being crashed at this point even we count for several decades.

comments.author: Raceonsucced
comments.body: actually in bitcoin investment there will definitely be times when you experience losses. in investing you must be prepared to lose, and get ready to profit. depending on how much we invest it, but I think in investing in bitcoin we will not be very poor if the price goes down.

comments.author: ChiBitCTy
comments.body: Just like with any asset I own, if it were in fact to “shoot” it’s way all the way down to zero, I would be fine. I would be fine because I understand the importance of diversification. Bitcoin is also far too volatile to hold too much of one’s assets in, as you need a well rounded portfolio.  Not to mention Bitcoin inherently isn’t even an investment, it’s a virtual currency/commodity.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: I would feel a bit stressed for a day or two and then I would continue with my life as usual, if the price is the right one, I would even consider to buy more Satoshis to harden my position in the market, in the long term. Otherwise, I guess I would only save some FIAT and keep an eye on the price to see what happens.Still, Bitcoin has proven itself to be a cyclical and resilient asset these last years. The community won't just go away if the price decreases.

I don't know about the BARAZAR project you are referring to, maybe it's a Ponzi project that promises high interest, so you can't compare it to bitcoin. Bitcoin has been around for 14 years and will continue to exist as long as we have demand for it, it is not a shitcoin project just to pump and dump. Bitcoin is the revolution of decentralized currency, of new technology, don't compare it to any junk project.As an investment, there will always be risks, so invest only the money you can lose. For me, it would not be wise to invest all my assets in bitcoin or any other investment.
